Simply build progressive webapps with SWAC

SWAC includes features for progressive webapps. With SWAC it's simplte to make a progressive webapp.

Makeing a webapp progressive

To make your webapp progressive there are only a view steps todo.

  1. Configure the manifest.json
  2. Activate progressive mode in configuration.js
  3. Declare pages and content for precaching

Configure the manifest.json

Place a manifest.json file in the root directory. An example can be downloaded here manifest.json download
Set the title of your application and the icons path.
This will give users the possibilty to install your webapp right to there homescreen (on supported mobile devices).

Activate progressive mode

Progressive mode can be simply activated in configuration.js in your application root.


...

SWAC_config.progressive = {};
SWAC_config.progressive.active = true;

...

Intelligent cacheing

SWAC caches application parts intelligent after usecase. Program components as scripts and pages are used from cache first to reduce bandwidth useage. Data is fetched from datasources first to get the actual data.

Control pre cached files

Simply note all files that should be precached for offline use. Most common once are allready listed.


...

SWAC_config.progressive.precache = [];
// List files here that should be available offline for the user after first visit
SWAC_config.progressive.precache[0] = SWAC_config.app_root + '/css/global.css';
SWAC_config.progressive.precache[1] = SWAC_config.app_root + '/sites/index.html';
SWAC_config.progressive.precache[2] = SWAC_config.app_root + '/css/index.css';
// basic content (design pictures)
SWAC_config.progressive.precache[3] = SWAC_config.app_root + '/content/header.jpg';
SWAC_config.progressive.precache[4] = SWAC_config.app_root + '/content/logo.jpg';
// default data
SWAC_config.progressive.precache[5] = SWAC_config.app_root + '/manifest.json';
SWAC_config.progressive.precache[6] = SWAC_config.app_root + '/configuration.js';
SWAC_config.progressive.precache[7] = SWAC_config.app_root + '/data/routes.json';

...

Control maximum age of cached files

You can set the maximum age of cached files in days. After those days the cached files are replaced with new ones. If the time is over but the user is offline, the old cached once are used until next connection.


SWAC_config.progressive.cachetimeout = 30;

Useing components offline

You don't only can precache your content files, but also the components you are useing. Simply note the name of the component you use, SWAC cares about caching all the files needed by the component.


SWAC_config.progressive.components = [];
SWAC_config.progressive.components[0] = 'Navigation';

Offline fallback content

If your application is offline and some sources could not be loaded from cache, than fallbacks are used to show the users information on how to get the latest content.
